question: In the late 19th century, which nation became the "Buffer State" in the "Great Game" between British empire and Russian empire?
explanation: During the 1st Anglo-Afghan War (1839-1842), the British East India company seized the control of Afghanistan. But, during the 3rd Anglo-Afghan War of 1919, Afghanistan was freed of British control of its affairs and got restored its monarchy under King Amanullah Khan.
